abstract: A prototype for a function callback that deallocates a given block of memory. In implementing this function, make the block of memory pointed to by `ptr` available for subsequent reuse by the allocator but unavailable for continued use by the program. The `ptr` parameter cannot be `NULL` and if the `ptr` parameter is not a block of memory that has been previously allocated by the allocator, the results are undefined; abnormal program termination can occur. You can set this callback to `NULL`, in which case the [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFAllocatorDeallocate(_:_:)] function has no effect.

# deallocate

**Instance Property**

A prototype for a function callback that deallocates a given block of memory. In implementing this function, make the block of memory pointed to by `ptr` available for subsequent reuse by the allocator but unavailable for continued use by the program. The `ptr` parameter cannot be `NULL` and if the `ptr` parameter is not a block of memory that has been previously allocated by the allocator, the results are undefined; abnormal program termination can occur. You can set this callback to `NULL`, in which case the [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFAllocatorDeallocate(_:_:)] function has no effect.

## Declaration

```swift
var deallocate: CFAllocatorDeallocateCallBack!
```
title: deallocate
